office:text.text:h: Selecting Image Caption also Selects the Image

text:p.text:span: This document is provided to give
These bugs do NOT appear within 6.1.0.3
Selecting the whole of an image caption
(eg for rename) also selects the image. If the caption is then deleted the image itself will also be deleted. The 1st letter needs to be de-selected to prevent that.
In addition, selecting all the text
will also select the image + caption above it. Deleting the text
paragraph will then delete both the paragraph + image + caption.
(command to create a new page) creates the new page
s below the image+caption, as in the final page (p6) of this bug-report, illustrates the way that the image captures the text within the 1
integral border is then coalesced with the bottom frame of the image, and the bottom spacing (here 0.5cm) of that frame is added *above* the paragraph text rather than between the two borders

text:p.text:span: LibreOffice 6.1.0.3 does NOT contain these bugs. A set of old AppImages that include that version are available from

text:list-item.text:p: Note that now both image + caption are both selected(s/b just the caption)
Do the same as (i) above, but this time start with the 1st letter of the 1st line on the paragraph that is below the Image.
Select to the end of the 1st line(no problem)
Select to the end of the whole paragraph(the whole of the image above + caption + paragraph below has been selected)(that’s greedy; deleting the paragraph will now delete everything)

text:p.text:span: This only happens on pages below that contain both an image + text below the image.

Note that the Page Break has been inserted

ake a visual inspection of the final page
Note that the image-frame bottom spacing (which is set at 0.5cm) is placed above the 1

It’s correct location should be between the bottom of the frame & the top of the text border. However, the top of the text border has been captured by the frame above it & is coalesced with the bottom border of that frame.
